Summary

Do you instinctively know how and when to take action? Do you love performing under pressure? 

As part of our Global Security group, you’ll help manage the security needs of Apple’s most valuable assets: our people, properties and innovations. Join us and you’ll play a significant role in preserving the highest standard of security for one of the most watched companies in the world.  

Apple's Global Security team is looking for a Corporate Security Partner to work directly with business units, vendors, and facilities teams to provide security services. 

Your work will help build solutions to a variety of unique security challenges, ranging from the physical security of sites and events, to the protection of our supply chain. You'll find develop solutions in order to support our physical security capabilities, increase the efficiency and effectiveness of our operation, and coordinate critical incidents affecting Apple.
Description
You will be a subject matter expert (SME) ensuring sites and events remain secure while serving as Apple's trusted security authority. In this role, you'll make critical decisions that directly impact business operations and employee safety, drive security strategy implementation across corporate sites, and partner directly with business leaders to assess and mitigate enterprise-level security risks. Your expertise will shape security protocols for incident prevention and confidential information protection, while leading external security vendors to ensure alignment with Apple's exacting standards.
 

In addition, the duties include but are not limited to:  

Work with leaders from the business groups who request security services to ensure each assignment and the scope of work are well planned, executed and confidential.  

Project management, attend meetings, and communicate updates to the team, including training and event debriefs.

Establish relationships with law enforcement, government agencies, EHS, facilities and outside vendors.   

Develop an in-depth understanding of Apple’s businesses and needs.  

Build, implement and maintain site or project specific security procedures and plans.  

Prepare operation orders and direct security vendor support.  

Manage field security requests for short-term and non-recurring assignments.  

Lead all aspects of a security budget, develop cost savers and resource planning.
Minimum Qualifications
Substantial corporate site security or program management experience or equivalent professional experience
Extensive experience in a high-volume, fast paced customer service setting
Excellent written and oral communication skills
Ability to react to changes in a time critical environment to meet security needs and quickly evaluate situations
Experience managing, coordinating and maintaining multiple projects
Ability to think quickly and perform problem-solving tasks within dynamic conditions
Demonstrate excellent communication with a strong attention to detail and courage to take initiative and drive projects to completion
Ability to work collaboratively and cross-functionally
Travel 10 - 25% of the time, with on-call responsibilities
Preferred Qualifications
Strong organisational skills
Experience crafting Keynotes and presenting to senior management
Cross functional global experience is a plus
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience
